resources.string: Who was the only President to serve more than two terms?
Who was the oldest elected President?
Who was the first President to live in the White House?

George Washington was the first President of the United States, the Commander-in-Chief of the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War, and one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.
Thomas Jefferson was an American Founding Father, the principal author of the Declaration of Independence, and the third President of the United States
Franklin Delano Roosevelt, commonly known by his initials FDR, was an American statesman and political leader who served as the 32nd President of the United States.
Ronald Wilson Reagan was an American actor and politician. He was the 40th President of the United States, and served as the 33rd Governor of California before his presidency.
John Adams was the second president of the United States, having earlier served as the first vice president of the United States.
James Madison, Jr. was an American statesman, political theorist and the fourth President of the United States.

Harry S. Truman was the 33rd President of the United States. As the final running mate of President Franklin D. Roosevelt in 1944, Truman succeeded to the presidency on April 12, 1945, when Roosevelt died after months of declining health.
George Herbert Walker Bush is an American retired politician who served as the 41st President of the United States.
1: You have to complete all the questions.
After answer one question you will be able to click on the picture for the more details.
